docs.snippet: Latin Americans are cheering for each other at the World Cup. But that camaraderie will disappear in a few days when the knockout games arrive.

docs.snippet: After England's World Cup fiasco, Roy Hodgson realizes the country is searching for a scapegoat, and accepts he's fortunate to have survived as coach.

docs.snippet: Eight matches gone and still Asia waits for a first win at the World Cup, with the struggles of the continent's four teams in Brazil demonstrating the coaching and administrative failings going on throughout the region.

docs.snippet: In the perfect picture of contrasting coaches' styles at this World Cup, Alejandro Sabella of Argentina stood near midfield dressed in a suit that looked appropriate for Wall Street, while Bosnia's Safet Susic stood nearby looking like he was headed...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the perfect picture of contrasting coaches' styles at this World Cup, Alejandro Sabella of Argentina stood near midfield dressed in a suit that looked appropriate for Wall Street, while Bosnia's Safet Susic stood nearby looking like he was headed for a workout.

headline.main: World Cup Coaches Have Drastically Varying Styles

docs.snippet: If France beats Ecuador in Wednesday's Group E match, it will be the first time it has won all three group games in a major competition since 1998 — the year it went on to win the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: If France beats Ecuador in Wednesday's Group E match, it will be the first time it has won all three group games in a major competition since 1998 — the year it went on to win the World Cup.

headline.main: France Looks to Repeat 1998 Feat With 3 Group Wins
headline.print_headline: France Looks to Repeat 1998 Feat With 3 Group Wins

docs.snippet: You dream for years, you travel thousands of kilometres, you spend a fortune - and then you end up watching your humiliated team play a totally meaningless World Cup game.

headline.main: Long-Suffering Fans Stick With England to Bitter End

docs.snippet: Rarely before at the World Cup has a coach revealed his team in public the day before a match. With nothing to play for, England coach Roy Hodgson did just that Monday for the Group D finale against Costa Rica.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rarely before at the World Cup has a coach revealed his team in public the day before a match. With nothing to play for, England coach Roy Hodgson did just that Monday for the Group D finale against Costa Rica.

headline.main: BRAZIL BEAT: Eliminated England Reveals Team Early
